New Records: Aaron Nola reached 199 1/3 innings in the season, close to 200.
Nick Castellanos played in all 162 games of the season, a first for the Phillies since 2007.
Key Match Events: Austin Clemens made a game-saving catch in the ninth inning to end the game.
Aaron Nola had a scary moment when Drew Millas hit a line drive off his back in the second inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Phillies manager Rob Thomson emphasized the importance of avoiding injuries during the postseason.
Nick Castellanos' ability to play all 162 games was noted as a significant achievement.
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson expressed pride in the team's resilience after the victory.
The victory marked a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phillies left fielder Austin Hays rejoined the team but faced a sore back, affecting his playing time.
The team prepared for the NLDS with an intrasquad game and taxi squad considerations.
Others: The game was part of the Phillies' regular-season finale, securing their position in the playoffs with a second-best record.
